intro: Lytoneuron ornithopus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and spiny, lobed leaves that are adapted to withstand salty air and strong winds. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Lytoneuron ornithopus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found growing on rocky shores or sandy beaches. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a distinctive feature of coastal flora.
